entries: You do not require sleep, are incapable of doing so, and can remain conscious during a long rest, though you must still refrain from strenuous activity to gain the benefit of the rest.

entries.name: Secondary Arms
entries: You have two slightly smaller secondary arms below your primary pair of arms. The secondary arms can manipulate an object, open or close a door or container, pick up or set down a Tiny object, or wield a weapon that has the light property. You may also use your primary and secondary arms to make an unarmed attack. When you do so, you roll twice the die you normally do, and the damage type is changed to slashing. For example, a regular thri-kreen may deal {@dice 2d2} slashing damage with their unarmed strike, but a monk may deal {@dice 2d4} or higher as their die increases.

entries.name: Insect Mouth
entries: Without the assistance of magic, you can't speak the non-thri-kreen languages you know. However, your mouth enables you to make a special unarmed attack in which you use your poisonous bite. A creature hit by your bite takes {@dice 1d6} piercing damage and must succeed on a Constitution saving throw equal to 8 + your proficiency modifier + your Constitution modifier or become {@condition Poisoned} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of their turn, ending the effect on themselves as a success. At level 5, your bite becomes so toxic that enemies {@condition Poisoned} in this way are also {@condition Paralyzed}.

entries.name: Thri-kreen Weapon Training
entries: You have proficiency with the Gythka and the Chatkcha.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write {@language Common|phb} and one other language that you and your DM agree is appropriate for your character.

entries.name: Age
entries: Due to their tribal lifestyle, they are considered adults at the age of 15 and usually live to a maximum of 50 years.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Troglodytes constantly war with nearby settlements, convinced the world was full of creatures seeking to kill them, a self-fulfilling prophecy that leads them towards Chaotic Evil.

entries.name: Size
entries: Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your base walking speed is 30 feet.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Keen Smell
entries: You have advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on smell.

entries.name: Bloodsense
entries: If there is any creature within 60 feet of you missing HP that is not behind total cover, that creature cannot gain the benefits of being unseen by you. {@filter constructs|bestiary|type=construct}, {@filter elementals|bestiary|type=elemental}, {@filter oozes|bestiary|type=ooze}, {@filter plants|bestiary|type=plant}, and {@filter undead|bestiary|type=undead} are immune to the effects of this sense.

entries.name: Fearsmell
entries: Your ability to smell is so refined that you can literally smell the fear given off nearby creatures. Among the creatures affected by your bloodsense, you are able to determine which among them has the lowest HP, as you can smell who is most afraid. Any creatures immune to being {@condition frightened} are likewise exempt from this ability. This ability is also disrupted if any of those creatures are {@condition frightened}, as you always smell them as being the most afraid. If multiple creatures within your bloodsense are {@condition frightened}, the creature with the lowest HP is who you can smell as being the most afraid.

entries.name: Claws
entries: You are proficient with your claw attack, which is a melee weapon attack that deals {@dice 1d4} piercing damage plus your Strength modifier, and can be made to attack as a bonus action if one is free to do so.

entries.name: Stench
entries: Any creature that can smell other than a troglodyte that starts its turn within 5 feet of you must succeed on a Constitution saving throw versus your Constitution DC (8 + Proficiency Bonus + Constitution modifier) or be {@condition poisoned} until the start of the creature's next turn. On a successful saving throw, the creature is immune to the stench of all troglodytes for 1 hour.

entries.name: Chameleon Skin
entries: You have advantage on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks made to hide.

entries.name: Violent Savagery
entries: You have disadvantage against saving throws related to being Frenzied.

entries.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries: You have disadvantage on attack rolls and on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight when you, the target of your attack, or whatever you are trying to perceive is in direct sunlight.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write {@language Common|phb} and {@language Troglodyte|mm}.

entries.name: Necrotic Shroud
entries: Starting at 3rd level, you can use your action to unleash the divine energy within yourself, causing your eyes to turn into pools of darkness and two skeletal, ghostly, flightless wings to sprout from your back. The instant you transform, other creatures within 10 feet of you that can see you must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw (DC 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Constitution modifier) or become {@condition frightened} of you until the end of your next turn.

Your transformation lasts for 1 minute or until you end it as a bonus action. During it, once on each of your turns, you can deal extra necrotic damage to one target when you deal damage to it with an attack or a spell. The extra necrotic damage equals your level.
Once you use this trait, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Radiant Soul
entries: Starting at 3rd level, you can use your action to unleash the divine energy within yourself, causing your eyes to glimmer and two luminous, incorporeal wings to sprout from your back.

Your transformation lasts for 1 minute or until you end it as a bonus action. During it, you have a flying speed of 30 feet, and once on each of your turns, you can deal extra radiant damage to one target when you deal damage to it with an attack or a spell. The extra radiant damage equals your level.
Once you use this trait, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Radiant Consumption
entries: Starting at 3rd level, you can use your action to unleash the divine energy within yourself, causing a searing light to radiate from you, pour out of your eyes and mouth, and threaten to char you.

Your transformation lasts for 1 minute or until you end it as a bonus action. During it, you shed bright light in a 10-foot radius and dim light for an additional 10 feet, and at the end of each of your turns, you and each creature within 10 feet of you take radiant damage equal to half your level (rounded up). In addition, once on each of your turns, you can deal extra radiant damage to one target when you deal damage to it with an attack or a spell. The extra radiant damage equals your level.
Once you use this trait, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Tinker
entries: You gain proficiency in {@item Tinker's Tools|OWL}.

entries.name: Self-Repairing Machine
entries: You know the {@spell mending|phb} cantrip. When you reach 3rd level, you can cast the {@spell repair|cooms} spell once with this trait and regain the ability to do so when you finish a short or long rest. When you reach 5th level, you can cast the {@spell lesser restoration|phb} spell once with this trait and regain the ability to do so when you finish a long rest. You may substitute {@item Tinker's Tools|OWL} as the material component for any of these spells when cast with a range of self. Constitution is your spellcasting ability for these spells.

entries.name: Specialized Design
entries: You gain one skill proficiency and one tool proficiency of your choice.

entries.name: Built for Success
entries: You can add your Constitution modifier to one attack roll, ability check, or saving throw you make. You can use this trait a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Size
entries: Grove cervans, which are almost always female, stand between 5 and 6 feet tall, and have light builds, weighing between 130 and 180 pounds. Your size is medium.

entries.name: Peaceful
entries: Cervans thrive together, and like to spend their time learning useful skills for life in their woodland villages. You gain proficiency in one of the following skills of your choice: {@skill Medicine|phb}, {@skill Nature|phb}, or {@skill Survival|phb}.

entries.name: Prosperous Magic
entries: You know the {@spell druidcraft|cooms} cantrip. When you reach 3rd level, you learn the {@spell purify food and drink|phb} spell and can cast it as a ritual. Additionally, you are able to cast it without spending a spell slot once per short or long rest. When you reach 5th level, you can cast the {@spell lesser restoration|phb} spell once with this trait and regain the ability to do so when you finish a long rest. Constitution is your spellcasting ability for these spells.

entries.name: Swift
entries: Your base walking speed increases to 35 feet.

entries.name: Nimble Step
entries: Opportunity attacks made against you are rolled with disadvantage.

entries.name: Healing Hands
entries: As an action, you can touch a creature and cause it to regain a number of hit points equal to your level. Once you use this trait, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Size
entries: Pronghorn cervans, which are almost always male, are taller and tend toward heavier, more muscular builds, standing around 7 feet tall, and sometimes weighing over 200 pounds. Your size is medium.

entries.name: Peaceful
entries: Cervans thrive together, and like to spend their time learning useful skills for life in their woodland villages. You gain proficiency in one of the following skills of your choice: {@skill Athletics|phb}, {@skill Nature|phb}, or {@skill Survival|phb}.

entries.name: Providing Magic
entries: You know the {@spell druidcraft|cooms} cantrip. When you reach 3rd level, you learn the {@spell detect poison and disease|phb} spell and can cast it as a ritual. Additionally, you are able to cast it without spending a spell slot once per short or long rest. When you reach 5th level, you can cast the {@spell locate animals or plants|phb} spell once with this trait and regain the ability to do so when you finish a long rest. Constitution is your spellcasting ability for these spells.

entries.name: Powerful Build
entries: You count as one size larger when determining your carrying capacity and the weight you can push, drag, or lift.

entries.name: Antlers
entries: You have a set of large, strong antlers that can be used to make devastating charge attacks as a last resort for those that wish to hurt you or your kin. You are proficient with your antlers attack, which is a melee weapon attack that deals {@dice 1d6} piercing damage plus your Strength modifier.

entries.name: Piercing Charge
entries: If you move at least 20 feet in a straight line towards an opponent, you can use a bonus action to make a special antlers attack as you charge them. If the attack hits, it deals its normal damage, and the creature must make a Strength saving throw against your Strength DC (8 + your proficiency bonus + your Strength modifier) or take an extra amount of {@dice d6} piercing damage equal to your proficiency bonus, only taking half as much on a success. If the target of your charge is Large or smaller and they fail the saving throw, you can choose to either push them 10 feet away from you as if you had shoved them twice, or you can choose to knock them prone. Once you hit with this feature, regardless of if your target succeeds or fails, you can't use this trait again until you finish a short or long rest.

entries.name: Chromatic Warding
entries: Starting at 5th level, as an action, you can channel your draconic energy to protect yourself. For 1 minute, you become immune to the damage type associated with your Chromatic Ancestry. Once you use this trait, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and Draconic. Draconic is thought to be one of the oldest languages and is often used in the study of magic. The language sounds harsh to most other creatures and includes numerous hard consonants and sibilants.

entries.name: Psionic Mind
entries: You can send telepathic messages to any creature you can see within 30 feet of you. You don't need to share a language with the creature for it to understand these messages, but it must be able to understand at least one language to comprehend them.

entries.name: Gem Flight
entries: Starting at 5th level, you can use a bonus action to manifest spectral wings on your body. These wings last for 1 minute. For the duration, you gain a flying speed equal to your walking speed and can hover. Once you use this trait, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and Draconic. Draconic is thought to be one of the oldest languages and is often used in the study of magic. The language sounds harsh to most other creatures and includes numerous hard consonants and sibilants.

entries.name: Metallic Breath Weapon
entries: At 5th level, you gain a second breath weapon. When you take the Attack action on your turn, you can replace one of your attacks with an exhalation in a 15-foot cone. The save DC for this breath is 8 + your Constitution modifier + your proficiency bonus. Whenever you use this trait, choose one:
{@b Enervating Breath}. Each creature in the cone must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or become incapacitated until the start of your next turn.
{@b Repulsion Breath}. Each creature in the cone must succeed on a Strength saving throw or be pushed 20 feet away from you and be knocked prone.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and Draconic. Draconic is thought to be one of the oldest languages and is often used in the study of magic. The language sounds harsh to most other creatures and includes numerous hard consonants and sibilants.

entries.name: Superior Darkvision
entries: Accustomed to life underground, you have superior vision in dark and dim conditions. You can see in dim light within 120 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Duergar Resilience
entries: You have advantage on saving throws against poison, and you have resistance against poison damage. You also have advantage on saving throws against illusions and against being {@condition charmed} or {@condition paralyzed}.

entries.name: Duergar Magic
entries: When you reach 3rd level, you can cast the {@spell enlarge/reduce|phb} spell on yourself once with this trait, using only the spell's enlarge option. When you reach 5th level, you can cast the {@spell invisibility|phb} spell on yourself once with this trait. You don't need material components for either spell, and you can't cast them while you're in direct sunlight, although sunlight has no effect on them once cast. You regain the ability to cast these spells with this trait when you finish a long rest. Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for these spells.

entries.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries: You have disadvantage on attack rolls and on Wisdom ({@skill perception}) checks that rely on sight when you, the target of your attack, or whatever you are trying to perceive is in direct sunlight.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common, Dwarvish, and Undercommon.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: Accustomed to life underground, you have superior vision in dark and dim conditions. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Dwarven Resilience
entries: You have advantage on saving throws against poison, and you have resistance against poison damage.

entries.name: Dwarven Toughness
entries: Your hit point maximum increases by 1, and it increases by 1 every time you gain a level.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and Dwarvish. Dwarvish is full of hard consonants and guttural sounds, and those characteristics spill over into whatever other language a dwarf might speak.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: Accustomed to life underground, you have superior vision in dark and dim conditions. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Dwarven Resilience
entries: You have advantage on saving throws against poison, and you have resistance against poison damage.

entries.name: Dwarven Armor Training
entries: You have proficiency with light and medium armor.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and Dwarvish. Dwarvish is full of hard consonants and guttural sounds, and those characteristics spill over into whatever other language a dwarf might speak.

entries.name: Superior Darkvision
entries: Accustomed to the depths of the Underdark, you have superior vision in dark and dim conditions. You can see in dim light within 120 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries: You have disadvantage on attack rolls and on Wisdom ({@skill Perception|phb}) checks that rely on sight when you, the target of your attack, or whatever you are trying to perceive is in direct sunlight.

entries.name: Drow Magic
entries: You know the {@spell dancing lights|cooms} cantrip. When you reach 3rd level, you can cast the {@spell faerie fire|phb} spell once with this trait; you regain the ability to cast it when you finish a long rest. When you reach 5th level, you can also cast the {@spell darkness|phb} spell once per day with this trait; you regain the ability to cast it when you finish a long rest. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for these spells.

entries.name: Drow Weapon Training
entries: You have proficiency with {@item rapier|OWL|rapiers}, {@item shortsword|OWL|shortswords}, and {@item hand crossbow|OWL|hand crossbows}.

subrace.name: Eladrin
entries: {@i Choose your eladrin's season: autumn, winter, spring, or summer. When finishing a long rest, you can change your season. See the "Info" tab for more information.}

entries.name: Fey Step
entries: As a bonus action, you can magically teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space you can see. Once you use this trait, you can't do so again until you finish a short or long rest.
When you reach 3rd level, your Fey Step gains an additional effect based on your season; if the effect requires a saving throw, the DC equals 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Charisma modifier:

items.name: Autumn
items.entry: Immediately after you use your Fey Step, up to two creatures of your choice that you can see within 10 feet of you must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition charmed|phb} by you for 1 minute, or until you or your companions deal any damage to it.

items.name: Winter
items.entry: When you use your Fey Step, one creature of your choice that you can see within 5 feet of you before you teleport must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition frightened|phb} of you until the end of your next turn.

items.name: Spring
items.entry: When you use your Fey Step, you can touch one willing creature within 5 feet of you. That creature then teleports instead of you, appearing in an unoccupied space of your choice that you can see within 30 feet of you.

items.name: Summer
items.entry: Immediately after you use your Fey Step, each creature of your choice that you can see within 5 feet of you takes fire damage equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of 1 damage).

entries.name: Creature Type
entries: You are a fey.

entries.name: Elf Weapon Training
entries: You have proficiency with the {@item longsword|OWL}, {@item shortsword|OWL}, {@item shortbow|OWL}, and {@item longbow|OWL}.

entries.name: Cantrip
entries: You know one {@filter cantrip of your choice from the wizard spell list|spells|level=0|class=Wizard}. Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for it.

entries.name: Extra Language
entries: You can speak, read, and write one extra language of your choosing.

entries.name: Incisive Sense
entries: You have advantage on Intelligence ({@skill Investigation|phb}) and Wisdom ({@skill Insight|phb}) checks.

entries.name: Blessing of the Moon Weaver
entries: You know the {@spell light|phb} cantrip. When you reach 3rd level, you can cast the {@spell sleep|phb} spell once with this trait and regain the ability to do so when you finish a long rest. When you reach 5th level, you can cast the {@spell invisibility|phb} spell (targeting yourself only) once with this trait and regain the ability to do so when you finish a long rest. Casting these spells with this trait doesn't require material components. Wisdom is your spellcasting ability for these spells.

entries.name: Sea Elf Training
entries: You have proficiency with the {@item spear|OWL}, {@item trident|OWL}, {@item light crossbow|OWL}, and {@item net|OWL}.

entries.name: Child of the Sea
entries: You have a swimming speed of 30 feet, and you can breathe air and water.

entries.name: Friend of the Sea
entries: Using gestures and sounds, you can communicate simple ideas with any beast that has an innate swimming speed.

entries.name: Extra Language
entries: You can speak, read, and write {@language Primordial|phb|Aquan}.

entries.name: Necrotic Resistance
entries: You have resistance to necrotic damage.

entries.name: Blessing of the Raven Queen
entries: As a bonus action, you can magically teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space you can see. Once you use this trait, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

Starting at 3rd level, you also gain resistance to all damage when you teleport using this trait. The resistance lasts until the start of your next turn. During that time, you appear ghostly and translucent.

entries.name: Elf Weapon Training
entries: You have proficiency with the {@item longsword|OWL}, {@item shortsword|OWL}, {@item shortbow|OWL}, and {@item longbow|OWL}.

entries.name: Fleet of Foot
entries: Your base walking speed increases to 35 feet.

entries.name: Mask of the Wild
entries: You can attempt to hide even when you are only lightly obscured by foliage, heavy rain, falling snow, mist, and other natural phenomena.

entries.name: Unending Breath
entries: You naturally produce the air that you breathe, and can share this air by locking lips with a creature. This also means that you can hold their breath indefinitely.

entries.name: Lightning Resistance
entries: You have resistance to lightning damage.

entries.name: Mingle with the Wind
entries: You know the {@spell gust|xge} cantrip. Starting at 3rd level, you can cast the {@spell feather fall|phb} spell with this trait, without requiring a material component. Starting 5th level, you can also cast the {@spell gust of wind|phb} spell with this trait, without requiring a material component. Once you cast either spell with this trait, you can't cast that spell with it again until you finish a long rest. You can also cast either of those spells using any spell slots you have of the appropriate level.
Constitution is your spellcasting ability for these spells when you cast them with this trait.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can understand and speak Common and Auran.

entries.name: Earth Walk
entries: You can move across difficult terrain made of earth or stone without expending extra movement.

entries.name: Stone Resistance
entries: You learn the {@spell blade ward|phb} cantrip and can cast it as a bonus action a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus per short rest, as you cause your rough skin to momentarily turn to stone. On top of this, you have advantage on saving throws against being {@condition petrified}.

entries.name: Merge with Stone
entries: You know the {@spell mold earth|xge} cantrip. Starting at 3rd level, you can cast the {@spell earth tremor|xge} spell with this trait, without requiring a material component. Starting 5th level, you can also cast the {@spell pass without trace|phb} spell with this trait, without requiring a material component. Once you cast either spell with this trait, you can't cast that spell with it again until you finish a long rest. You can also cast either of those spells using any spell slots you have of the appropriate level.
Constitution is your spellcasting ability for these spells when you cast them with this trait.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can understand and speak Common and Terran.

entries.name: Flaming Hair
entries: Fire genasi sport a head of hair that is either made of fire or constantly aflame. They shed bright light out to 10 feet and dim light an additional 10 feet, and can choose to dim their hair at will to half the light they produce.

entries.name: Fire Resistance
entries: You have resistance to fire damage.

entries.name: Reach to the Blaze
entries: You know the {@spell control flames|xge} cantrip. Starting at 3rd level, you can cast the {@spell burning hands|phb} spell with this trait, without requiring a material component. Starting 5th level, you can also cast the {@spell flame blade|phb} spell with this trait, without requiring a material component. Once you cast either spell with this trait, you can't cast that spell with it again until you finish a long rest. You can also cast either of those spells using any spell slots you have of the appropriate level.
Constitution is your spellcasting ability for these spells when you cast them with this trait.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can understand and speak Common and Ignan.

entries.name: Amphibious
entries: You can breathe air and water.

entries.name: Acid Resistance
entries: You have resistance to acid damage.

entries.name: Call to the Wave
entries: You know the {@spell shape water|xge} cantrip. Starting at 3rd level, you can cast the {@spell create or destroy water|phb} spell with this trait, without requiring a material component. Starting 5th level, you can also cast the {@spell misty step|phb} spell with this trait, without requiring a material component. Once you cast either spell with this trait, you can't cast that spell with it again until you finish a long rest. You can also cast either of those spells using any spell slots you have of the appropriate level.
Constitution is your spellcasting ability for these spells when you cast them with this trait.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can understand and speak Common and Aquan.

entries.name: Duergar Resilience
entries: You have advantage on saving throws against poison, and you have resistance against poison damage. You also have advantage on saving throws against illusions and against being {@condition charmed} or {@condition paralyzed}.

entries.name: Variant Feature (Choose 1)
entries: Choose one of the following options:
{@b Skill Versatility.} You gain proficiency in two skills of your choice.
{@b Dwarven Combat Training.} You have proficiency with the {@item battleaxe|phb}, {@item handaxe|phb}, {@item light hammer|phb}, {@item warhammer|phb}, and {@item war pick|phb}.
{@b Tool Proficiency.} You gain proficiency with the artisan's tools of your choice: {@item smith's tools|phb}, {@item brewer's supplies|phb}, or {@item mason's tools|phb}.

{@b Talented Miner.} You dig twice as fast as other races, allowing you to tunnel and mine ore in half the time that it would take for members of another race. If you spend ten minutes planning a course for the next hour of spelunking, you can ensure that any tunnels that you make during that time will not collapse.

{@b Duergar Magic.} When you reach 3rd level, you can cast the {@spell enlarge/reduce|phb} spell on yourself once with this trait, using only the spell's enlarge option. When you reach 5th level, you can cast the {@spell invisibility|phb} spell on yourself once with this trait. You don't need material components for either spell, and you can't cast them while you're in direct sunlight, although sunlight has no effect on them once cast. You regain the ability to cast these spells with this trait when you finish a long rest. Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for these spells.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and Dwarvish.

entries: Half-Dragons have the same size as their non-dragon parent. Your size is Small.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Half-Dragons have a base speed equal to their non-dragon parent's base speed. Your base walking speed is 25 feet.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common, Gnomish, and Draconic. Draconic is thought to be one of the oldest languages and is often used in the study of magic. The language sounds harsh to most other creatures and includes numerous hard consonants and sibilants.

entries.name: Variant Resilience (Choose 1)
entries: Choose one of the following options:
{@b Draconic Resilience.} You have resistance to the damage type associated with your draconic ancestry.
{@b Gnome Cunning.} You have advantage on all Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma saving throws against magic.

entries.name: Variant Feature (Choose 1)
entries: Choose one of the following options:
{@b Blindsight.} You have the ability to see within 10 feet of yourself without relying on your eyes. Enemies within this range do not gain the benefits of being unseen by you.

{@b Superior Darkvision.} Accustomed to life underground, you have superior vision in dark and dim conditions. You can see in dim light within 120 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.
{@b Stone Camouflage.} You have advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks to hide in rocky terrain.
{@b Natural Illusionist.} You know the {@spell minor illusion|phb} cantrip. Constitution is your spellcasting ability for it.

{@b Speak with Small Beasts.} Through sounds and gestures, you can communicate simple ideas with Small or smaller beasts. Forest gnomes love animals and often keep squirrels, badgers, rabbits, moles, woodpeckers, and other creatures as beloved pets.

{@b Artificer's Lore.} Whenever you make an Intelligence (History) or Intelligence (Arcana) check related to magic items, alchemical objects, or technological devices, you can add twice your proficiency bonus, instead of any proficiency bonus you normally apply.

{@b Tinker.} You have proficiency with artisan's tools ({@item tinker's tools|phb|Tinker's Tools}). Using those tools, you can spend 1 hour and 10 gp worth of materials to construct a Tiny clockwork device (AC 5, 1 hp). The device ceases to function after 24 hours (unless you spend 1 hour repairing it to keep the device functioning), or when you use your action to dismantle it; at that time, you can reclaim the materials used to create it. You can have up to three such devices active at a time.

entries.name: When you create a device, choose one of the following options:
entries: {@b Clockwork Toy.} This toy is a clockwork animal, monster, or person, such as a frog, mouse, bird, dragon, or soldier. When placed on the ground, the toy moves 5 feet across the ground on each of your turns in a random direction. It makes noises as appropriate to the creature it represents.
{@b Fire Starter.} The device produces a miniature flame, which you can use to light a candle, torch, or campfire. Using the device requires your action.
{@b Music Box.} When opened, this music box plays a single song at a moderate volume. The box stops playing when it reaches the song's end or when it is closed.

entries: You can speak, read, and write Common, Halfling, and Draconic. Draconic is thought to be one of the oldest languages and is often used in the study of magic. The language sounds harsh to most other creatures and includes numerous hard consonants and sibilants.

entries.name: Variant Resilience (Choose 1)
entries: Choose one of the following options:
{@b Draconic Resilience.} You have resistance to the damage type associated with your draconic ancestry.
{@b Brave.} You have advantage on saving throws against being {@condition frightened|phb}.

entries.name: Variant Feature (Choose 1)
entries: Choose one of the following options:
{@b Blindsight.} You have the ability to see within 10 feet of yourself without relying on your eyes. Enemies within this range do not gain the benefits of being unseen by you.
{@b Lucky.} When you roll a 1 on an attack roll, ability check, or saving throw, you can reroll the die and must use the new roll.
{@b Halfling Nimbleness.} You can move through the space of any creature that is of a size larger than yours.

{@b Silent Speech.} You can speak telepathically to any creature within 30 feet of you. The creature understands you only if the two of you share a language. You can speak telepathically in this way to one creature at a time.
{@b Naturally Stealthy.} You can attempt to hide even when you are obscured only by a creature that is at least one size larger than you.

{@b Child of the Wood.} You know the {@spell druidcraft|phb} cantrip. When you reach 3rd level, you can cast the {@spell entangle|phb} spell once with this trait and regain the ability to do so when you finish a long rest. When you reach 5th level, you can cast the {@spell spike growth|phb} spell once with this trait and regain the ability to do so when you finish a long rest. Casting these spells with this trait doesn't require material components. Wisdom is your spellcasting ability for these spells.
{@b Timberwalk.} Ability checks made to track you have disadvantage, and you can move across difficult terrain made of nonmagical plants and undergrowth without expending extra movement.
{@b Stout Resilience.} You have advantage on saving throws against poison, and you have resistance against poison damage.

entries: Half-Dragons have a base speed equal to their non-dragon parent's base speed. Your base walking speed is 30 feet.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and Draconic. Draconic is thought to be one of the oldest languages and is often used in the study of magic. The language sounds harsh to most other creatures and includes numerous hard consonants and sibilants.

entries.name: Draconic Resilience.
entries: You have resistance to the damage type associated with your draconic ancestry.

entries.name: Variant Feature (Choose 1)
entries: Choose one of the following options:
{@b Skill Versatility.} You gain proficiency in two skills of your choice.
{@b Blindsight.} You have the ability to see within 10 feet of yourself without relying on your eyes. Enemies within this range do not gain the benefits of being unseen by you.

entries.name: Drought Resistance
entries: Due to your natural proclivity towards areas with little to no water, you can go up to a month without water. You also take half damage from spells that drain moisture like {@spell Blight|COOMS}.

entries.name: Spiny
entries: Spines cover your body. Your unarmed attack deals piercing damage equal to {@dice 1d4} + your Strength modifier, instead of the bludgeoning damage normal for an unarmed strike. On top of this, anybody who attacks you with an unarmed strike takes {@dice 1d4} piercing damage.

entries.name: Freakish Appearance
entries: Flytrap Leshies normally hunt in pacts and scare their prey into accidentally scurrying into a trap set by them. You have proficiency in {@skill Intimidation} and {@skill Stealth}.

entries.name: Acidic Bite
entries: Your mouth is lined with digestive acids, allowing you to eat even if your teeth aren't too sharp. Your unarmed attack deals acid damage equal to {@dice 1d6} + your Constitution modifier, instead of the bludgeoning damage normal for an unarmed strike.

entries.name: Reclusive
entries: Because of the value your body naturally provides as a source of food and curative magics, most Fruit Leshies are recluses, and tend to live in small, hidden communities out of fear of exploitation by outsiders. You gain proficiency in {@skill Medicine} and {@skill Stealth}.

entries.name: Nourishing
entries: Your body naturally bears nutritious and flavorful fruit. You can cast {@spell Goodberry|phb} once per long rest innately, using Constitution as your spellcasting ability modifier. Additionally, any creature that eats a majority of your corpse within a tenday of your death absorbs your natural healing and nourishing magic, and gains the following benefits:

items: They lose all tiers of exhaustion currently affecting them.
One disease or lingering injury affecting the target is immediately cured.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Sporecasting
entries: You know the {@spell Poison Spray|phb} cantrip. When you reach 3rd level, you can cast the {@spell Toxic Mist|COOMS} spell once with this trait; you gain the ability to cast it again when you finish a long rest. When you reach 5th level, you regain your ability to cast {@spell Toxic Mist|COOMS} on a short or long rest. Constitution is the spellcasting ability for these spells.

entries.name: Hard Rind
entries: Your gourd, though expressive and articulable to you, is still incredibly hard to others. Whenever you are hit with a critical strike, you may reduce the damage you take by a number of {@dice d4} equal to your proficiency bonus.

entries.name: Hollow Head
entries: You have a large, hollow gourd for a skull that you use to store things in. You can store up to 10 lbs worth of items within your head. Additionally, if you store only one object within your head, you can draw it effortlessly into your hand as part of the Use an Object or Attack action.

entries.name: Favorable Winds
entries: When you dash, you are carried away by winds, and can move an additional amount of feet equal to 5 times your proficiency bonus.

entries.name: Graceful Falls
entries: Your body is made mostly from natural foliage, and like a leaf tumbling from a tree, you land from falls with particular grace. You have proficiency in the {@skill Acrobatics} skill and the maximum damage you can take from any fall is {@dice 1d6}, as you reach your terminal velocity at 10 feet of falling.

entries.name: Natural Beauty
entries: Your grace and elegance flows in every move you do. You have proficiency in {@skill Acrobatics} and {@skill Performance}.

entries.name: Water Walking
entries: You can walk on the surface of still water, and it counts as difficult terrain for you. Flowing water requires an {@skill Acrobatics} check to balance on it with a DC equal to its DC to swim with an {@skill Athletics} check.

entries.name: Natural Armor
entries: Your body is covered in tough bark and littered with needles. When you aren't wearing armor, your AC is 13 + your Constitution modifier. You can use your natural armor to determine your AC if the armor you wear would leave you with a lower AC. A shield's benefits apply as normal while you use your natural armor.
On top of this, anybody who attacks you with an unarmed strike takes {@dice 1d4} piercing damage.

entries.name: Sticky Sap
entries: You have a sticky sap that excretes from your body, making climbing, grappling, and holding onto your gear easier. You have a bonus to {@skill Athletics} checks and Strength saving throws equal to your Constitution modifier, minimum of 0. This bonus does not apply while you are underwater or airborne.

entries.name: Hearty Roots
entries: Your hit point maximum increases by 1, and it increases by 1 every time you gain a level.

entries.name: Sure Footing
entries: You have proficiency in {@skill Athletics} and, while you are not airborne, swimming, or mounting a creature, you have advantage on Strength saving throws.

entries.name: Tangled Form
entries: You have advantage on all grapple checks.

entries.name: Underwater Habitat
entries: You are used to life in the water, and gain a swimming speed equal to your walking speed. You can also breathe underwater.

entries.name: Sun Sense
entries: Sunflower Leshies have an innate obsession with the sun that affords them many benefits. You always know what direction is north and you always know what time it is, as you can sense the sun's location in the sky even without seeing it.

entries.name: Seed Spray
entries: When you take the attack action on your turn, you can replace one of your attacks with an attack unique to your kind. You launch a deluge of seeds from your head in a 15-foot cone. Creatures in the area must make a Dexterity saving throw versus your Constitution DC or take a number of {@dice d6} bludgeoning damage equal to your proficiency bonus, with half as much on a successful save. You can use this feature a number of times per long rest equal to your Constitution modifier (minimum of 1).

entries.name: Lashing Vines
entries: You know the {@spell Thorn Whip|phb} cantrip and can cast it innately using Dexterity as your spellcasting ability.

entries.name: Creeping Climbers
entries: You gain a climbing speed equal to your walking speed, and climbing for you does not require hands.

entries.name: Duergar Resilience
entries: You have advantage on saving throws against poison, and you have resistance against poison damage. You also have advantage on saving throws against illusions and against being {@condition charmed} or {@condition paralyzed}.

entries.name: Duergar Magic
entries: When you reach 3rd level, you can cast the {@spell Enlarge/Reduce} spell on yourself once with this trait, using only the spell's enlarge option. When you reach 5th level, you can cast the {@spell Invisibility} spell on yourself once with this trait. You don't need material components for either spell, and you can't cast them while you're in direct sunlight, although sunlight has no effect on them once cast. You regain the ability to cast these spells with this trait when you finish a long rest. Constitution is your spellcasting ability for these spells.

entries.name: Variant Feature (Choose 1)
entries: Choose one of the following options:
{@b Natural Athlete.} You have proficiency in the {@skill Athletics} skill.
{@b Mountain Born.} You have resistance to cold damage. You're also acclimated to high altitude, including elevations above 20,000 feet.
{@b Dwarven Combat Training.} You have proficiency with the {@item battleaxe|phb}, {@item handaxe|phb}, {@item light hammer|phb}, {@item warhammer|phb}, and {@item war pick|phb}.
{@b Tool Proficiency.} You gain proficiency with the artisan's tools of your choice: {@item smith's tools|phb}, {@item brewer's supplies|phb}, or {@item mason's tools|phb}.

{@b Talented Miner.} You dig twice as fast as other races, allowing you to tunnel and mine ore in half the time that it would take for members of another race. If you spend ten minutes planning a course for the next hour of spelunking, you can ensure that any tunnels that you make during that time will not collapse.

{@b Stone's Endurance.} You can focus yourself to occasionally shrug off injury. When you take damage, you can use your reaction to roll a {@dice d12}. Add your Constitution modifier to the number rolled, and reduce the damage by that total. After you use this trait, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

entries.name: Natural Athlete
entries: You have proficiency in the {@skill Athletics} skill.

entries.name: Dwarven Toughness
entries: Your hit point maximum increases by 1, and it increases by 1 every time you gain a level.
